page.title: 01Topography.
page.content: Squares 5 and 9, together with half of 6 and 10, comprise reclaimed marshland brought into use as grazing land by medieval and later drainage works. The rest of the D-block would origin- ally have been heavily wooded, part of the great Baltonsbury Wood mentioned in medieval documents and shown on 16th century maps.The last portion, used as common grazing, was Northwood, enclosed in 1720. The soils of the marsh portion are alluvium and this area is part of the Somerset Levels.The highest portion, above 40' contour, is clay overlaying blue lias.
